name: Immediate release oral morphine liquid
title: Immediate release oral morphine liquid
description: Milligrams of immediate release oral morphine liquid per 1000 patients
numerator_short: mg of liquid oral morphine formulations
why_it_matters: Oral liquid morphine has been implicated in a number of drug-related deaths in the NHS, including cases of unintentional overdose.
A national patient safety investigation has highlighted risks associated with morphine oral solution, including dosing errors and accidental overconsumption.

Particular concerns include the risk of patients 'swigging' morphine oral solution directly from the bottle rather than measuring individual doses, and the supply of large quantities over extended periods.
The classification of oral morphine solution 10 mg in 5 mL as a Schedule 5 Controlled Drug, rather than a Schedule 2 like other morphine formulations, means it is subject to fewer controls.
This may increase the likelihood of larger volumes being supplied and continued without the safeguards applied to other opioid formulations.
In addition, morphine oral solution contains high quantities of alcohol and sugar as excipients.
For example, branded Oramorph contains around 90 g of sugar and 24 g of ethanol, equivalent to three units of alcohol, in each 300 mL bottle.
These factors should be considered alongside the opioid content when assessing clinical risk.

numerator_from:
{hscic}.normalised_prescribing p
INNER JOIN {dmd}.vmp vmp ON CONCAT(SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,0,9),'AA', SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,-2), SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,-2)) = vmp.bnf_code -- joins prescribing data to vmp table using generic BNF code 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.vpi AS vpi ON vmp.id = vpi.vmp -- joins vmp to vpi table to get ingredient strengths (strnt_nmrtr_val) 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.ont AS ont ON vmp.id = ont.vmp -- joins vmp to ont table to get formulation codes 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.ontformroute AS route ON ont.form = route.cd -- joins ont table to ontform table to get formulation names
numerator_where: vpi.ing = 60886004 AND route.descr = ('solution.oral') -- morphine oral solution preparations
testing_comments: Simple test to identify new morphine products. The measure relies on dm+d codes/route so this test might over identify products.
